creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: 3/4 view of a woman with long blonde hair wearing a pink checked and flowered dress; grey form with pink triangles in background; flowers at bottom, right of center; landscape elements in URQ; muted colors
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription and Stamp

in margins, in pencil: artist\'s color notes
markings: on back, LRC, stamped in black: [H.M.P. (inside an oval)] [Henri M. Petiet, Paris]
medium: Color lithograph; trial proof with pencil notations
provenance:
Henri M. Petiet, Paris (his sale; Piasa, Paris, June 7, 2007, lot 76); [C.G. Boerner, Paris and New York; sold to Dayton]; Ruth and Bruce Dayton, Wayzata, Minn.; given to MIA, 2008.

Note from Armin Kunz: Our Denis proof set comes  from Petiet, and we do not know where he acquired it. The Petiet collection is much older than the Josefowitz collection. We know that all the handwritten annotations must have been done by Denis and were intended for Clot, the printer. It is likely that the printer held onto these proofs and kept them (rather than giving them back to the artist).
But this is not certain, as there are no stamps or documents that prove this contention.
signed: below image, lower left, printed in yellow: [les crépuscules ont une douceur / d\'ancienne peinture]; below image, lower right, in pencil: [Maurice Denis]
title: The Twilights Have the Softness of an Old Painting, from "Love"
